texto: The Industrial Revolution began in Great Britain in the late 18th century. It was a period of scientific and technological development that transformed rural societies into urban and industrial ones. The key invention was the STEAM ENGINE, which powered factories and trains. While it brought economic growth, it also caused problems like child labor and pollution. Thousands of people moved from the countryside to cities, looking for work in the new 'dark satanic mills'. This period changed the way we live and work forever.

texto: During World War I, soldiers lived in long, narrow ditches called TRENCHES. Life there was incredibly difficult. The trenches were often muddy, infested with rats, and smelled terrible. Soldiers spent months in these conditions, facing the constant threat of enemy fire and disease. Between the opposing trenches was 'No Man's Land', a dangerous area full of barbed wire. Many soldiers wrote letters back home, describing the boredom and the horror of the war that was supposed to 'end all wars'.

opciones: The dangerous area between opposing trenches

texto: In the 1950s and 60s, a struggle for social justice took place in the USA. African Americans fought to end racial SEGREGATION and gain equal rights. Rosa Parks became a hero when she refused to give up her bus seat to a white man. Later, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. led the movement with his philosophy of non-violence. His famous 'I Have a Dream' speech inspired millions. Thanks to their courage, the Civil Rights Act was passed in 1964, making discrimination illegal in public places.

texto: Climate change is one of the most serious problems facing our planet today. Human activities, such as burning fossil fuels and deforestation, are increasing the amount of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. This causes the 'Greenhouse Effect', trapping heat and making the Earth warmer. As a result, polar ice caps are melting, and sea levels are rising. Scientists warn that we must act now by using renewable energy and reducing our carbon footprint to protect the environment for future generations.

texto: Before the 20th century, a simple infection could be fatal. In 1928, Alexander Fleming made a revolutionary discovery by accident. He noticed that a type of mold called 'Penicillium' had killed the bacteria in his laboratory Petri dish. This was the first ANTIBIOTIC. Penicillin saved millions of lives during World War II and changed medicine forever. Fleming was awarded the Nobel Prize for his work, which allowed doctors to treat diseases like pneumonia or tuberculosis that were previously incurable.

texto: The internet has changed the world more than any other recent invention. In the beginning, it was a military project called ARPANET. In the 1990s, Tim Berners-Lee created the WORLD WIDE WEB, making the internet accessible to everyone. Today, we use it for everything: education, shopping, social media, and entertainment. However, it also has risks, such as cyberbullying and fake news. We must learn to be responsible 'digital citizens' and protect our personal data while enjoying the benefits of being connected.

texto: Shakespeare is considered the greatest writer in the English language. He was born in Stratford-upon-Avon in 1564. He wrote 38 plays, including tragedies like 'Hamlet' and 'Romeo and Juliet', and comedies like 'A Midsummer Night's Dream'. He also wrote beautiful sonnets. His plays were performed at the GLOBE THEATRE in London. Shakespeare invented many words and phrases that we still use today. His work explores universal human emotions such as love, jealousy, and ambition, which is why it is still popular after 400 years.

texto: The Space Race was a competition between the USA and the Soviet Union during the Cold War. It began in 1957 when the USSR launched SPUTNIK, the first satellite. In 1961, Yuri Gagarin became the first human in space. President John F. Kennedy challenged America to land a man on the moon before the end of the decade. In 1969, Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin achieved this goal with the Apollo 11 mission. Armstrong famously said: 'That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind'.

texto: Today, many people have a sedentary lifestyle because they spend too much time sitting in front of screens. This can lead to health problems like obesity and stress. To stay healthy, doctors recommend 30 minutes of physical activity every day. Eating a BALANCED DIET with plenty of fruits and vegetables is also essential. Moreover, getting enough sleep (8 hours) is important for mental health and concentration. Small changes, like walking to school or drinking more water, can make a big difference in the long run.

texto: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the ability of a computer or robot to perform tasks that usually require human intelligence. This includes learning, problem-solving, and understanding language. AI is already part of our lives, from Siri and Alexa to Netflix recommendations and autonomous cars. Some people are worried that AI will replace jobs, while others believe it will help solve humanity's biggest problems. The future of AI depends on how we use it and ensure that it is ethical and safe for everyone.
